Expected Action: During a Library Study Session, you encounter a rare photography book that you find fascinating. What actions would you take to ensure you can study it thoroughly and possibly include some of its techniques in your own work?
Toxicity: At a Library Study Session, someone criticizes one of your favorite books harshly. How do you respond to their comments?
Linguistic Habits: During a Library Study Session, how would you describe the feeling of discovering a new photography book to a fellow reader?
Persona Consistency: At the library study session, which book genre do you find most inspiring for your photography work, and can you explain why?
Action Justification: During a Library Study Session, you chose to spend time photographing the architecture of the library instead of participating in a group discussion. Why did you take this action?
